newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to sell one pct of UES this year.
newsitem.headline: Russia to sell one pct of UES this year.

text.p: Russia plans to sell around one percent of national power company Unified Energy System (UES) this year to raise around 220 billion roubles ($38.4 million), a senior privatisation official said on Tuesday.

Alexander Zhigach, head of the regional coordination department in the State Property Committee, Russia's privatisation ministry, told Reuters the stake was part of a series of sell-offs planned this year.
An outline of privatisation plans for this year, issued by his department, calls for revenues of 1.55 trillion roubles from selling shares in RAO Yedinaya Energeticheskaya Sistema Rossii (UES).
But Zhigach said the sale of 8.49 percent of UES late last year had already raised 1.332 trillion roubles, which had been credited to this year's budget.
"We will sell a small packet of shares of around one percent this year for the remaining sum," Zhigach said.
The state currently owns a little over 52 percent of the company, UES's director for asset management Alexander Lopatin told Reuters.
It must retain ownership of 51 percent until March 31, 1998.

The plan issued by Zhigach's department listed the following privatisation revenues to be raised this year through sales of state-owned shares by the State Property Committee and Russian Federal Property Fund:
Total privatisation revenues this year, including sales and renting of real estate, will be 6.53 trillion roubles, it said.
The government previously had announced plans to sell 49 percent of Svyazinvest, 1.5-2.0 percent of UES and 50 percent of Rosgosstrakh, as well as stakes in several oil companies, this year.
